column4: how can i test if ubuntu knows my windows key is there? i want to assign the command 3ddesk to it
it does... it's called the Super Key, by the way
how can i test? and in this guide i got it calls it Super_L
i only have one windows key so should i leave off the _L?
i guess i'll try _L and _R and see which works
the Right one may be the "menu" iconned one
Super, Super_L, and Super_R don't work. but i tested <Control>a and it worked, so my windows key must not be recognised as Super_L/R
you've tried the keyboard shortcuts preferences in GNOME, right?
my "windows key" is Super_L, according to that
just pick one of the items, and hit your button
it doesn't do anything, so i guess linux doesn't recognize my super key?
any idea how to fix that?
